data.text: Wine is an intemperate thing, and strong drink full of violence:
The threat of a king differs not from the rage of a lion;
It is a glory to a man to turn aside from railing;
A sluggard when reproached is not ashamed:
Counsel in a man’s heart is deep water;
A man is valuable, and a merciful man precious:
He that walks blameless in justice,
Whenever a righteous king sits on the throne,
Who will boast that he has a pure heart?
The lamp of him that reviles father or mother shall be put out,
A portion hastily gotten at first
Say not, I will avenge myself on my enemy;
A large and small weight, and diverse measures,
A youth when in company with a godly man, will be restrained in his devices,
The ear hears, and the eye sees:
Love not to speak ill, lest thou be cut off:
A double weight is an abomination to the Lord;
A man’s goings are directed of the Lord:
It is a snare to a man hastily to consecrate some of his own property:
A wise king utterly crushes the ungodly,
The spirit of man is a light of the Lord,
Mercy and truth are a guard to a king,
Wisdom is an ornament to young men;
Bruises and contusions befall bad men;
